**More Info**

**K-12 Programs & Group Visits**

[More Info](/education/k-12-programs-group-visits "More Info: K-12 Programs & Group Visits")

* * *

  * __Hours

Monday  | CLOSED |   
---|---|---  
Tuesday  | 10:00 am – 5:00 pm |   
Wednesday  | 10:00 am – 5:00 pm |   
Thursday  | 10:00 am – 5:00 pm |   
Friday  | 10:00 am – 5:00 pm |   
Saturday  | 10:00 am – 5:00 pm |   
Sunday  | 12:00 pm – 5:00 pm |   

Closed Mondays (except for Yale Commencement and MLK Day) and on these major holidays: New Year’s Day, Fourth of July, Thanksgiving Day, Christmas Eve, and Christmas Day.

**Do I need a ticket to visit?**

No! The Peabody is open to **all** , with no time or date restrictions for individual visitors. We encourage you to come visit anytime during our open hours.

**What about group visits?**

accessibility_text:
# 

Accessibility

## 

Visit the Peabody

Expand All 

Mobility Needs 

  * The Yale Peabody Museum has multiple wheelchair-accessible entrances, and multiple passenger elevators.
  * Accessible Parking is available in lot 22v on the corner of Whitney Avenue and Humphrey Street.
  * When planning your visit, we advise all guests to explore drop off, rideshare (Uber, Lyft, etc), or carpool options.
  * Wheelchairs are available for use on a first come, first served basis. Please visit the front desk to request one.
  * Seating is provided within the galleries. Rest spaces are also located throughout the museum.
  * Lightweight foldable stools are available throughout the museum and can be requested at the front desk.

Blind or Low Vision 

  * Sighted guides available upon prior request via [peabody.visit@yale.edu](mailto:peabody.visit@yale.edu)
  * Touchable items are located throughout the fossil galleries on the first floor, including depictions of the large murals. The Living Lab, on the third floor, also features many things that can be handled.
  * A keypad with headphone jack is available to provide audio navigation and descriptions for multimedia kiosks throughout the galleries.
  * Audio descriptions for some touchable items are available through the Amuse app. These are indicated by raised QR codes with an audio description symbol. New audio descriptions will continue to be added. This content is also accessible through the web app and does not require a download.

[More Info](/support/membership "More Info: Become a Member")

* * *

### Monday, January 19

**__12:00 pm – 4:00 pm**

**Festival / Family Day**

#### [Martin Luther King Jr. Day of Service and Celebration](/events/mlk-celebration)

Join over a dozen community organizations as they gather at the Yale Peabody Museum to celebrate Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.’s work, offering knowledge about food, educational, racial, and environmental justice.
